page.title: 09YOXALL_AGRICULTURE
page.content: Dairy farming and beef production with mainly Friesian cattle are paramount. Since joining the Common Market there has been a growing surplus of beef and dairy products which has led to many farmers being forced to reduce their herds which are now limited by a quota system based on 1983 figures minus 10% and price of milk to producers has gone down forcing at least 5 local farmers to cease production.Most of the land is pasture but some cereal and root crops are grown.Hay is only produced in small quantities as most grass is cut for silage.A trout farm on the Sudbury Road sells fish directly to the public and also has a licence to restock lakes.Recently much of the stock died possibly due to oxygen deficiency.The matter is still under investigation.
